revised_title: Flux Trapping in Superconductors: A Study of Indium-Tin Alloys
tldr: This article investigates the amount of trapped flux in superconductors, specifically indium-tin alloys, as a function of temperature. The experiments reveal that the proportion of trapped flux increases with indium concentration. A model based on the theories of London & London and Gorter & Casimir, incorporating the concept of coherence, is developed to explain the observed behavior.
